name: Ext_R4B_RegulatedAuthorization
title: Cross-version Extension for R4B.RegulatedAuthorization for use in FHIR R4
description: This cross-version extension represents RegulatedAuthorization from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/RegulatedAuthorization|4.3.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: Regulatory approval, clearance or licencing related to a regulated product, treatment, facility or activity e.g. Market Authorization for a Medicinal Product
element.definition: Regulatory approval, clearance or licencing related to a regulated product, treatment, facility or activity that is cited in a guidance, regulation, rule or legislative act. An example is Market Authorization relating to a Medicinal Product.

element.short: Overall type of this authorization, for example drug marketing approval, orphan drug designation
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents RegulatedAuthorization.type from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/RegulatedAuthorization|4.3.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: Overall type of this authorization, for example drug marketing approval, orphan drug designation
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents RegulatedAuthorization.type from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/RegulatedAuthorization|4.3.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: General textual supporting information
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents RegulatedAuthorization.description from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/RegulatedAuthorization|4.3.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: General textual supporting information
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents RegulatedAuthorization.description from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/RegulatedAuthorization|4.3.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The territory in which the authorization has been granted
element.definition: The territory (e.g., country, jurisdiction etc.) in which the authorization has been granted.

element.short: The territory in which the authorization has been granted
element.definition: The territory (e.g., country, jurisdiction etc.) in which the authorization has been granted.

element.short: The status that is authorised e.g. approved. Intermediate states can be tracked with cases and applications
element.definition: The status that is authorised e.g. approved. Intermediate states and actions can be tracked with cases and applications.

element.short: The status that is authorised e.g. approved. Intermediate states can be tracked with cases and applications
element.definition: The status that is authorised e.g. approved. Intermediate states and actions can be tracked with cases and applications.

binding.description: The lifecycle status of an artifact.

element.short: The date at which the current status was assigned
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents RegulatedAuthorization.statusDate from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/RegulatedAuthorization|4.3.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The date at which the current status was assigned
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents RegulatedAuthorization.statusDate from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/RegulatedAuthorization|4.3.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The time period in which the regulatory approval etc. is in effect, e.g. a Marketing Authorization includes the date of authorization and/or expiration date
element.definition: The time period in which the regulatory approval, clearance or licencing is in effect. As an example, a Marketing Authorization includes the date of authorization and/or an expiration date.

element.short: The time period in which the regulatory approval etc. is in effect, e.g. a Marketing Authorization includes the date of authorization and/or expiration date
element.definition: The time period in which the regulatory approval, clearance or licencing is in effect. As an example, a Marketing Authorization includes the date of authorization and/or an expiration date.

element.short: Condition for which the use of the regulated product applies
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents RegulatedAuthorization.indication from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/RegulatedAuthorization|4.3.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: Reference to a concept (by class)
element.definition: A reference to a concept - e.g. the information is identified by its general class to the degree of precision found in the terminology.

element.short: Reference to a concept (by class)
element.definition: A reference to a concept - e.g. the information is identified by its general class to the degree of precision found in the terminology.

element.short: Reference to a resource (by instance)
element.definition: A reference to a resource the provides exact details about the information being referenced.

element.short: Reference to a resource (by instance)
element.definition: A reference to a resource the provides exact details about the information being referenced.

element.short: Data type name for RegulatedAuthorization.indication from FHIR R4B
element.definition: Data type name for RegulatedAuthorization.indication from FHIR R4B

element.short: The intended use of the product, e.g. prevention, treatment
element.definition: The intended use of the product, e.g. prevention, treatment, diagnosis.

element.short: The intended use of the product, e.g. prevention, treatment
element.definition: The intended use of the product, e.g. prevention, treatment, diagnosis.

binding.description: The overall intended use of a product.

element.short: The legal/regulatory framework or reasons under which this authorization is granted
element.definition: The legal or regulatory framework against which this authorization is granted, or other reasons for it.

element.short: The legal/regulatory framework or reasons under which this authorization is granted
element.definition: The legal or regulatory framework against which this authorization is granted, or other reasons for it.

binding.description: A legal or regulatory framework against which an authorization is granted, or other reasons for it.

element.short: The organization that has been granted this authorization, by the regulator
element.definition: The organization that has been granted this authorization, by some authoritative body (the 'regulator').

element.short: The organization that has been granted this authorization, by the regulator
element.definition: The organization that has been granted this authorization, by some authoritative body (the 'regulator').

element.short: The regulatory authority or authorizing body granting the authorization
element.definition: The regulatory authority or authorizing body granting the authorization. For example, European Medicines Agency (EMA), Food and Drug Administration (FDA), Health Canada (HC), etc.

element.short: The regulatory authority or authorizing body granting the authorization
element.definition: The regulatory authority or authorizing body granting the authorization. For example, European Medicines Agency (EMA), Food and Drug Administration (FDA), Health Canada (HC), etc.

element.short: The case or regulatory procedure for granting or amending a regulated authorization. Note: This area is subject to ongoing review and the workgroup is seeking implementer feedback on its use (see link at bottom of page)
element.definition: The case or regulatory procedure for granting or amending a regulated authorization. An authorization is granted in response to submissions/applications by those seeking authorization. A case is the administrative process that deals with the application(s) that relate to this and assesses them. Note: This area is subject to ongoing review and the workgroup is seeking implementer feedback on its use (see link at bottom of page).

element.short: Identifier by which this case can be referenced
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents RegulatedAuthorization.case.identifier from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/RegulatedAuthorization|4.3.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: Identifier by which this case can be referenced
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents RegulatedAuthorization.case.identifier from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/RegulatedAuthorization|4.3.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The defining type of case
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents RegulatedAuthorization.case.type from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/RegulatedAuthorization|4.3.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The defining type of case
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents RegulatedAuthorization.case.type from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/RegulatedAuthorization|4.3.0 for use in FHIR R4.

binding.description: The type of a case involved in an application.

element.short: The status associated with the case
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents RegulatedAuthorization.case.status from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/RegulatedAuthorization|4.3.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The status associated with the case
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents RegulatedAuthorization.case.status from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/RegulatedAuthorization|4.3.0 for use in FHIR R4.

binding.description: The lifecycle status of an artifact.

element.short: Relevant date for this case
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents RegulatedAuthorization.case.date[x] from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/RegulatedAuthorization|4.3.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: Relevant date for this case
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents RegulatedAuthorization.case.date[x] from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/RegulatedAuthorization|4.3.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: Applications submitted to obtain a regulated authorization. Steps within the longer running case or procedure
element.definition: A regulatory submission from an organization to a regulator, as part of an assessing case. Multiple applications may occur over time, with more or different information to support or modify the submission or the authorization. The applications can be considered as steps within the longer running case or procedure for this authorization process.

element.short: Data type name for RegulatedAuthorization.case.application from FHIR R4B
element.definition: Data type name for RegulatedAuthorization.case.application from FHIR R4B
